channel.title: Logs on Leonid Gremyachikh
channel.description: Recent content in Logs on Leonid Gremyachikh

item.title: Course: Computer Vision (OTUS)
item.description: Photo by Runze Shi on Unsplash I took a course on Сomputer Vision from OTUS (in Russian) from April 28 to September 25, 2020. The course was practical and covered Neural Networks and Deep Learning in the field of Computer Vision - from the basics to the latest frameworks and state-of-the-art scientific articles. Besides that, there were cool lessons about TensorRT and Server Inference. In addition, the interesting thing about this course was to learn from the experience of colleagues who use Computer Vision in different fields.

item.title: Speech: SMILES (ML school at Skoltech)
item.description: Participated in the international summer school SMILES – The Summer School of Machine Learning at Skoltech from 16 to 21 August 2020. In the poster session, I talked about two “AI & Satellite Problems” projects that we were engaged at the Laboratory of Methods for Big Data Analysis at the National Research University Higher School of Economics. Below is the submitted poster and the certificate provide. Poster PDF Certificate PDF Post about Data Analysis for Satellite Tracking

item.title: Task creation: IDAO (HSE University ML Olympiad)
Course: Generative Models School
item.description: Autumn School on Generative Models – HSE University and Yandex autumn school on generative models.

item.title: Conference: Space debris
item.description: “Space debris: fundamental and practical aspects of the threat”, Russian conference with international participation (Moscow, Institute of Astronomy RAS and Space Research Institute RAS, 2019)

item.title: Hackathon: RL Hackathon, A!ONE
item.description: I participated in the Reinforcement Learning hackathon from MTS at the A!ONE conference. It was required to develop an agent for a slightly modified CarRacing-v0 OpenAI GYM environment.
